attr.d: Specifies the URL of the page the link goes to
Specifies where to open the linked document

acronym.desc: Not supported in HTML5. Defines an acronym

address.desc: Defines contact information for the author/owner of a document

area.desc: Defines an area inside an image-map

aside.desc: Defines content aside from the page content

base.desc: Specifies the base URL/target for all relative URLs in a document

bdi.desc:
Isolates a part of text that might be formatted in a different direction 
from other text outside it

blockquote.desc: Defines a section that is quoted from another source

canvas.desc: Used to draw graphics, on the fly, via scripting (usually JavaScript)

cite.desc: Defines the title of a work

code.desc: Defines a piece of computer code

col.desc: Specifies column properties for each column within a <colgroup> element

colgroup.desc: Specifies a group of one or more columns in a table for formatting

command.desc: Defines a command button that a user can invoke

datalist.desc: Specifies a list of pre-defined options for input controls

dd.desc: Defines a description/value of a term in a description list

del.desc: Defines text that has been deleted from a document

details.desc: Defines additional details that the user can view or hide

dialog.desc: Defines a dialog box or window

div.desc: Defines a section in a document

dt.desc: Defines a term/name in a description list

embed.desc: Defines a container for an external (non-HTML) application

fieldset.desc: Groups related elements in a form

figcaption.desc: Defines a caption for a <figure> element

footer.desc: Defines a footer for a document or section

form.desc: Defines an HTML form for user input

header.desc: Defines a header for a document or section

hr.desc: Defines a thematic change in the content

html.desc: Defines the root of an HTML document

i.desc: Defines a part of text in an alternate voice or mood

ins.desc: Defines a text that has been inserted into a document

keygen.desc: Defines a key-pair generator field (for forms)

label.desc: Defines a label for an <input> element

legend.desc: Defines a caption for a <fieldset> element

link.desc:
Defines the relationship between a document and an external resource (most 
used to link to style sheets)

meta.desc: Defines metadata about an HTML document

meter.desc: Defines a scalar measurement within a known range (a gauge)

noscript.desc:
Defines an alternate content for users that do not support 
client-side scripts

optgroup.desc: Defines a group of related options in a drop-down list

option.desc: Defines an option in a drop-down list

output.desc: Defines the result of a calculation

param.desc: Defines a parameter for an object

progress.desc: Represents the progress of a task

rp.desc: Defines what to show in browsers that do not support ruby annotations

rt.desc:
Defines an explanation/pronunciation of characters (for East Asian 
typography)

ruby.desc: Defines a ruby annotation (for East Asian typography)

s.desc: Defines text that is no longer correct

samp.desc: Defines sample output from a computer program

section.desc: Defines a section in a document

source.desc: Defines multiple media resources for media elements (<video> and <audio>)

span.desc: Defines a section in a document

style.desc: Defines style information for a document

summary.desc: Defines a visible heading for a <details> element

tbody.desc: Groups the body content in a table

td.desc: Defines a cell in a table

textarea.desc: Defines a multiline input control (text area)

tfoot.desc: Groups the footer content in a table

th.desc: Defines a header cell in a table

thead.desc: Groups the header content in a table

title.desc: Defines a title for the document

tr.desc: Defines a row in a table

track.desc: Defines text tracks for media elements (<video> and <audio>)

u.desc: Defines text that should be stylistically different from normal text
